overview_of_class: Applications to illustrate typical problems and methods of applied mathematics. Mathematical formulation of models for phenomena in science and engineering, problem solution, and interpretation of results. Examples from solid and fluid mechanics, combustion, diffusion phenomena, chemical and nuclear reactors, and biological processes.
name: Models in Applied Mathematics
title: MEAS ES_APPM 421-1-20 Models in Applied Mathematics

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Applications to illustrate typical problems and methods of applied mathematics. Mathematical formulation of models for phenomena in science and engineering, problem solution, and interpretation of results. Examples from solid and fluid mechanics, combustion, diffusion phenomena, chemical and nuclear reactors, and biological processes.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: No text book is required. Several books will be on reserve at the library.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Suggested)
descriptions.value:
No Text will be required.
The course syllabus will list several recommended reference books which will be put on reserve in the Northwestern Library.
